en.resources:
* Kanter, J. W., Kuczynski, A. M., Tsai, M., & Kohlenberg, R. J. (2018). A brief contextual behavioral intervention to improve relationships: A randomized trial. Journal of contextual behavioral science, 10, 75-84.

* Kanter, J. W., Kuczynski, A. M., Manbeck, K. E., Corey, M. D., & Wallace, E. C. (2020). An integrative contextual behavioral model of intimate relations. Journal of Contextual Behavioral Science.

* Aron, A., Melinat, E., Aron, E. N., Vallone, R. D., & Bator, R. J. (1997). The experimental generation of interpersonal closeness: A procedure and some preliminary findings. Personality and social psychology bulletin, 23(4), 363-377.

* Collins, N. L., & Miller, L. C. (1994). Self-disclosure and liking: a meta-analytic review. Psychological bulletin, 116(3), 457.

* Oswald, D. L., Clark, E. M., & Kelly, C. M. (2004). Friendship maintenance: An analysis of individual and dyad behaviors. Journal of Social and clinical psychology, 23(3), 413-441.

* Reis, H. T., Shaver, P., Duck, S., & Hay, D. F. (1988). Intimacy as an interpersonal process. Handbook of personal relationships.

Helping couples connect during the COVID‐19 pandemic: A pilot randomised controlled trial of an awareness, courage, and love intervention. Applied Psychology: Health and Well‐Being, 12(4), 1140-1156.
en.name: Nourishing Relationships
en.intro: This course explores several powerful ways to strengthen and deepen your relationships. In times of hardship, few things are as important as experiencing deep connection to others.
en.description:
In tough times we need each other more than ever. At the same time we easily forget to nourish our relations when we’re in the midst of turmoil. This course explores several powerful ways to strengthen and deepen your relationships.

## What will I learn?

- Find courage to love
- Create safety for others to do the same
- Learn how to fully express yourself in a relationship

## How does it work?

- This course consists of 3 lessons.
- By doing this course together with a group of friends, colleagues or other people in the 29k app, you gain more value from the course, and get support along the journey.
- After completing each lesson, you can have a sharing session with your group to dive deeper into each topic. This is an opportunity to be present, learn from each other, and create a safe space for meaningful human connection.

#### Who created this course?

This course has been created in collaboration with the renowned relationship researchers Mavis Tsai and Jonathan W Kanter, and was edited by 29k psychologist Daniel Ek. The content in the course is based on well-researched exercises and interventions and a list of scientific references can be found below.

#### About 29k

29k is a Swedish foundation and one of the initiating partners of the IDGs initiative. 29k's mission is to democratize access to inner development. 29k does this via a non-profit, open-source digital platform that provides free access to evidence-based psychological tools for mental health and inner development. All interventions are co-created together with leading researchers on the topic in question. Check out more at [www.29k.org](https://29k.org).
